Yeah, this place was excellent.  It's located in a very clean, local market, Mercat del Ninot.  Much smaller than La Boqueria but way better maintained and nicer.  It felt like a local market (which it is) and not completely overrun with tourists.  The seafood was SO fresh.  Everything we ordered was cooked in such a simple way, but the flavours were absolutely fantastic!Service was definitely friendly, welcoming, and we enjoyed ourselves thoroughly.  Please keep in mind, this is not a typical restaurant.  You're sitting at a seafood bar.  Order a drink, enjoy watching the preparation of your food, and savour.At one point, our chef asked to take a photo with the lady next to me.  I was wondering who that was and found out it was Carme Ruscalleda, a Michelin 3 star (total of 5 star) chef!  She has 3 stars for her restaurant in Spain, and 2 more for the one in Tokyo!  How cool is that???
